column5: After last weekends skunking and a real disappointment ... was looking forward to today  Weather wise, it was looking good, but a cold one again, minus a couple of degrees  -20C with windchill -28C actually    Ah well, went ahead and booked the day off and went fishing    Dreamed of landing some beauties over night and today, got into some nice ones.... but, with all my reports, details first  I left home around 7h30am and temp was -17C with windchill -27C   North West winds at 22km/h, humidity at 65%.... well when I got to destination it was -21C and didn't know the wind factor but it was cold  A snow storm had gone thru the valley last night and drop some heavy snow further north... All this to say that I had to brake trail to get to my spot    Here's a shot from the lake    As you can see, lots of snow had fallen  So I punched 4 holes and got setup... here's a closer look of my office space  First couple of rods    The other two    Closer look of number 4    Went 7 for 11 and what worked well, was the salties and Gulp paste in pink on a dead stick    Nothing on jigging    First time trying the paste and was real surprised at how easy it was to cover the entire hook  Here's the group hug!!!    Biggest was 12 3/4"... got the first 3 in 15 minutes and then #4 & 5 was a double header on the dead stick   Wasn't quick enough with the camera  But after that, couldn't leave you high & dry so made a video to explain the details of my setup and got a surprise as I was explaining    you just have to watch it and crank up the volume to hear me talking All in all, drove 4 hours, fished for 4 and got into some beauties Bait of choice was, salties & Gulp paste in pink on dead stick, Macho minnow tipped with Gulp fish fry in white and 1/4oz chartreuse jig with grub & tipped with 1" Gulp minnow Enjoy! Leechman  <embed width="600" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowFullscreen="true" allowNetworking="all" wmode="transparent" src="http://static.photobucket.com/player.swf" flashvars="file=http%3A%2F%2Fvid732.photobucket.com%2Falbums%2Fww321%2Fleechman1%2FIce%2520Fishing%25202012%2FSpeckle%2520Hunt%2520Jan%252020%25202012%2FIceFishingJan202012.mp4">

Do you fish that spot in the summer too? I think I recognize it from one of your summer posts. Great video, very cool to see you pull a fish up! I've never tried that paste before, I'll have to try it the next time I'm hunting for specs.  mmmm la truite mouchete!
Nice report Jacques!!!! Looks like a pretty cold day.Nothing better than flash frozen fishies
Great stuff, Jacques.  I can taste those specks now.  Still amazes me that you can use that many lines at once...definitely makes for an efficient setup.
Man that looks like alot of fun!!!!  I'm jealous...
You are having more luck than us folks down in the banana belt.  Well done.
Sweet !!!
4 lines eh?  Very nice outing there Jaques. Your efforts were nicely rewarded. As Bill Murray said in Caddyshack - you gotta be pleased about that.

Yes I do Chad  Same spot   Thanks!!! First time using paste and it works real well!  It comes in 2 colours (pink & chartreuse).  Give it a try, you won't regret it!   Thanks Paul!!! It was cold with the wind gusting constantly... it didn't take long for the fish to freeze that's for sure   Thanks Frankie!!! I can setup 5 up here but yesterday only used 4    With that many lines out in this cold temp, it's a lot of work maintaining the holes ice free   every couple of minutes had to do the rounds   Thanks Manitou!!!   Thanks Bruce!!!   Thanks Carp!!!   Thanks spincast!!! I was happy and pleased to see the bigger ones come out to play
wow...now i know where all the snow went!  Great job Jacques....again.  i'm with manitou on this one...jealous!  But pleased for ya bud...awesome season so far....keep up the good work!

Thanks Simon!!! and no kidding  Lots of snow over here so far... not good for making good ice but what can you do    Just got to go out there and enjoy  Ice was about a foot thick and lots of slush under that layer of snow as you can see on the pics... a couple hours into fishing and slush turned into a slippery path making walking or running a challenge  So far so good and really enjoying my season Thanks again my friend!!!
Sweet post Jaques. Keep them coming.
Jacques, I fish the Big lakes for Salmon and big Walleye, but you can give me that fishing any day. You are one lucky boy to have that near by. Thanks for sharing, love the video.
Thanks Vinni!!!   Thanks Dan!!!  Another is coming for sure.... uploading the pics but this time it's stealhead and perch   Thanks Fish Farmer!!!  Glad you enjoyed it
Nice haul there Jacques! I can see that the weather helped to flash freeze the fish for you. I'm sure when you thaw them up in a little butter, they are going to be a nice tasty meal.  Cheers.
Thanks Tony!!!  Yeah she was a cold one that day and got rewarded beautifully for my efforts    You bet
Ok my friend, do I have to come up there to kick you for all the teasing that you are causing
You mind as well but not for the kicking though
Great report and video! thanx for sharing
Thought you said you traveled light?  Looks like a heavy drag "BACK" me son.LOL   Nice fish,n bud.
Thanks LesCulpJr!!!   But I do me son    sometimes Thanks Bud!!!
